result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricardo Dominguez Bucio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Cash bail applied to fine.  Fine paid in full.  Balance refunded to poster.
Court WAIVES DNA Sample/Surcharge based on date of violation.
14CT1846 and 16CM885 are dismissed and read in.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence (no early completion of community service and must be completed at 5 hours per month), payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Defendant to perform a total of 60 hours at the rate of 5 hours per month within 1 year, to be monitored through WCS.
06-20-2018 DEFENDANT HAS COMPLETED 40 OF THE 60 HOURS. COURT WAIVES THE BALANCE AND CONSIDERS C.S. SATISFIED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricardo Dominguez Bucio

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ricardo Dominguez Bucio in court.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant has completed 40 of the 60 hours.  The court waives the balance of the community service and deems the community service completed.
From WCS dated 6/18/18 re defendant's failure to complete community service, additional hours still need to be completed.
Review hearing on June 20, 2018 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Ricardo Dominguez Bucio in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The court calls the case to address the court ordered community service.  The defendant informs the court he has not completed any of the community service.   The court admonishes the defendant and grants a 2 month extension to complete the community service.  Failure to complete the community service will result in a penalty of 20 days jail.  The court schedules the case for a hearing in approximately 60 days.  Review hearing scheduled for June 20, 2018 at 09:00 am.
Review hearing on April 18, 2018 at 08:30 am.

WCS Community Service non-compliance dated March 23, 2018.
  **Reviewed by Judge Michael J. Aprahamian on 3/26/18; Schedule hearing in mid April.**

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services Rendered filed by Atty Procaccio.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Ricardo Dominguez Bucio in court with attorney Anthony J Procaccio.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.


The Defendant was sentenced as follows:

Count #1:

FINE: $568.00(apply cash bail and balance to be refunded to poster);

DNA SURCHARGE/SAMPLE:  waived based on date of violation.

COMMUNITY SERVICE:  The Defendant is to perform a total of 60 Hours at the rate of 5 hours per month within 1 year, to be monitored by WCS.

  Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence (no early completion of community service (must be completed at 5 hours per month), payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ricardo Dominguez Bucio in court, in custody.  Attorney Kelsey Moran appears as a friend of the Court.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morin advises the Court the Defendant does not qualify for representation by the public defender's office and an attorney will not be appointed.   The Defendant is sworn in and the examined by the Court.  The Court finds the Defendant is eligible and will appoint an attorney at the repayment rate of $50.00 per month commencing 8/1/16. The Court sets cash bail in the amount of $100.00 on 14CT1846 and 15CM1591 and $200.00 on 16CM885.  The Cour quashes the warrant. Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on June 1, 2016 at 10:30 am.
